mlr3mbspls 0.2.12

Supervised multi-block sPLS treating the target as an extra block

Source: R/PipeOpMBsPLSXY.R
PipeOpMBsPLSXY.Rd

PipeOpMBsPLSXY is a supervised variant of MB-sPLS. During training, the target (\(Y\)) is appended as its own block alongside the input blocks \(X_1,\dots,X_B\), so that extracted components maximize correlation between X-blocks and Y. For downstream learners, only the X-side latent scores (LVs) are output (no Y leakage).

Handling encoded column names. If upstream encoding expands/renames factors into dummy columns like "base.level" (e.g., via PipeOpEncode(method = "treatment" | "one-hot")), you may keep using the base names in blocks (e.g., "MINI_dx"). At $train(), base names are expanded to the actual post-encoding columns via regex ^<base>(\.|$). The resolved names are stored and reused at prediction; any missing columns are filled with zeros.

For classification tasks, Y is internally one-hot encoded (no intercept). You can replicate the target block via y_rep to increase its weight in the objective.

Sparsity constraints. Either provide a full c_matrix (rows = blocks including target, columns = components), or use per-block c_<block> parameters plus c_target for the target block.

Value

A PipeOpMBsPLSXY that appends columns LVk_<block> for each X-block.

Details

Supervised Multi-Block Sparse PLS (MB-sPLS-XY) Transformer

State after training

blocks_x

Resolved X-blocks (numeric, non-constant features).

ncomp

Number of extracted components.

weights_x, loadings_x

Lists per component with weights/loadings per X-block.

performance_metric

"mac" (mean absolute correlation) or "frobenius".

Prediction

During $predict(), X-scores are computed component-wise with deflation and returned as new columns LVk_<block>. The Y-block is not needed. Any columns that existed at training but are missing at prediction are created as all-zero columns.

Parameters

Hyperparameters are defined in the object's param_set and can be set via param_vals.

See also

PipeOpMBsPLS for the unsupervised variant, mlr3pipelines::PipeOpEncode for post-encoding column names.

Super classes

mlr3pipelines::PipeOp -> mlr3pipelines::PipeOpTaskPreproc -> PipeOpMBsPLSXY

Public fields

blocks

(list) Named base names of X-blocks (resolved post-encoding during training).

Method new()

Creates a new PipeOpMBsPLSXY instance.

Usage

PipeOpMBsPLSXY$new(id = "mbsplsxy", blocks, param_vals = list())

Arguments

id

character(1) Identifier (default "mbsplsxy").

blocks

Named list mapping block names to base feature names (required).

param_vals

Initial param_set values.

Returns

A new PipeOpMBsPLSXY.

Method clone()

The objects of this class are cloneable with this method.

Usage

PipeOpMBsPLSXY$clone(deep = FALSE)

Arguments

deep

Whether to make a deep clone.
